abstract.text: Asks the delegate for the height of the specified row.

inlineContent.text: The table view that sent the message.
The row index.
The height of the row. The height doesn’t include intercell spacing and must be greater than zero.
Implement this method if your table supports varying row heights.
Although table views may cache the returned values, you should ensure that this method is efficient. When you change a row’s height you must invalidate the existing row height by calling
automatically invalidates its entire row height cache in response to calls to
or
If you call
or
within your implementation of this method, the table view throws an exception.
To avoid the possibility of a hang due to unexpected recursion, don’t call geometry-calculating methods such as
, or any
method that calls
within your implementation of this method, such as
. To confirm your code isn’t inadvertently causing any calls to
, set a breakpoint on
in Xcode.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A set of related records, displayed in rows that represent individual records and columns that represent the attributes of those records.
The horizontal and vertical spacing between cells.
Informs the table view that the rows specified in
have changed height.
Informs the table view that the number of records in its data source has changed.
Returns the rectangle containing the column at the specified index.
Marks the table view as needing redisplay, so it will reload the data for visible cells and draw the new values.
Returns a row view at the specified index, creating one if necessary.
Properly sizes the table view and its header view and marks it as needing display.
Returns a view at the specified row and column indexes, creating one if necessary.
A set of optional methods you implement in a table view delegate to customize the behavior of the table view.
Asks the delegate for the height of the specified row.
Asks the delegate to provide custom sizing behavior when a column’s resize divider is double clicked.
The view’s bounds rectangle, which expresses its location and size in its own coordinate system.
The basic type for all floating-point values.
Describes an integer.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A signed integer value type.

inlineContent.text: The table view that sent the message.
The row index.
The height of the row. The height doesn’t include intercell spacing and must be greater than zero.
